content.text: Measure and record the width \(x\) of the thin paper strip, as shown in Fig. 1.1
Connect the clips to the strip, as shown in Fig. 1.2
Set up the apparatus with the top clip supported on the nail, as shown in Fig. 1.3
Twist the wooden rod through an angle of approximately \(45^{\circ}\) in a horizontal plane, as shown in Fig. 1.4
Release the rod and watch its movement
The wooden rod completes one swing by twisting one way and then back the other way, as shown in Fig. 1.4
The time taken for each complete swing is \(T.\)
By timing several of these complete swings, determine an accurate value for \(T.\)

By cutting new strips from the graph paper, repeat **(a)** and **(b)** until you have six sets of values of \(x\) and \(T.\) Values of \(x\) should be in the range \(1 \text{cm} \leq x \leq 6 \text{cm}\)
Include values of \(\frac{1}{x}\) in your table of results
Plot a graph of \(T\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{1}{x}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
